title: I keep getting an error message when trying to download emails on Windows 11 device. "Connection to Server mail.besttelecom.net.au was reset".

I can access my emails fine using one of my android devises through Thunderbird, biut my Windows 11 devices refuse to co-operate. I deleted certificates in the hope that Thunderbird would download and attach new certificates, but this has not happened either. I have tried changing ports and security TLS. I can however, access my mail.besttelecom.net.au emails using outlook. I have been using Thunderbird since it's first appearance and prefer it to any other email manager.I have heaps of data stored in it which I access regularly, so I would prefer not going to another email manager.

title: Blocco dei "contenuti remoti"
content:
Ciao e grazie anticipatamente per il supporto, sto usando Thunderbid 142.0 su W11 e credo ci sia un comportamento inatteso. Uso Thunderbird su una casella GMAIL con PGP: ho creato le mie chiavi private e pubbliche, che sono riconosciute da PROTON (servizio di mail crittografata che uso da web o client), infatti le mail verso PROTON sono correttamente decriptate. Ovviamente anche PROTON ha le chiavi PGP e scambia mail regolarmente con GMAIL, che Thunderbird decripta correttamente. Problema: se metto una foto nel messaggio email che mando da PROTON a GMAIL, Thunderbird quando la riceve mi dice che blocca i contenuti remoti e non mi permette di scaricarli (manca il bottone delle opzioni), ma me la ritrovo come allegato alla mail che posso aprire (vedi Thunderbird.png). Ho provato a mettere la eccezione dell'indirizzo email nelle impostazioni di Privacy e sicurezza dell'account GMAIL, ma segnala lo stesso il problema. Se mando da GMAIL a PROTON una mail con una immagine, in PROTON vedo un segnalibro di "oggetto mancante" (quindi non viene mandata) -- e non arriva NULLA, nemmeno come allegato (vedi PROTON.png). Come ultimo tentativi ho anche abilitato "permetti contenuti remoti dentro i messaggi" dalle impostazioni globali, ma Thunderbird continua a dirmi che "ha bloccato i contenuti remoti".

C'è qualche spiegazione? può essere che la crittografia PGP abbia problemi con le foto? (nota: Thunderbird mi dice che è tutto OK -2 lucchetti con spunta verde- nel bottone "OpenPGP").

Grazie mille anticipatamente del supporto!

Beppe
creator: giuseppe.miotti

title: Calendar sync to/from BT email only works for full day events
content: Since a problem with my BT email account (hacked) and its restoration I only seem able to sync between the two calendars when the diary entry is ticked as a whole day event. This appears to happen in both directions. In other words try to log an event with start and end times and it does not get synced to the other diary (and visa versa). I also suspect that the times of the two systems are not in sync but cannot find where to check them both. I assume that they both access W11 for the data. Any thoughts much appreciated.
creator: frank.noton

title: Digitally signing  Issue
content:
Been using thunderbird for at least 20 years, and learn to live with the bugs and wait for the next release waiting and expecting the issues of the previous release were solved in the next one.

I've been using S/MIME certificates for many years without problem. I've recently installed a new certificate wich is correctly installed in my personal repository expiring in 2027. Since version 141 this certificates shows as selected, but is not used. Updated to release 142 ... but the problem persists.

I'm attaching a screen capture were shows the error message and the Developers Console showing the exitcode when trying to send a mail with digitally signed.

Please also note (i don´t know if this is related or not) that when y check the certificate in the account the hexadecimal ID of the certificate is not shown. If I clear the certificate and select it again it is shown in this screen. Attached to this you can find a capture of what mentioned before.

Please let me know if more information is needed.

Thanks / Regards


Ariel Pereira
creator: apereira1970

I wasn't happy with the UI changes burying the menus into the hamburger on the side, but figured I could live with it. Not sure the benefit, maybe it looks cleaner? But removing functionality at the same time is really NOT helpful.

Anyone have any ideas how to find the error log or find the email causing Thunderbird to stop seeing downloadable emails?

title: "Message Options" to view all headers.
content:
The old Outlook app has a function of "Message Options" that allows you to view all the message headers, without opening the message, to determine if the Email is spam or contains malicious 'packages'. Spammers fake the basic FROM information, but within the headers you can see where the message actually originated from and which servers it passed through. It is a safety feature to prevent automatic 'confirmation of receipt' and other cyberstalking responses upon opening of the Email by deleting it before opening. How can I do the same thing using Thunderbird.

Example: Return-Path: <01010198ce4******-cca7-4763-bd7c-736abf31a416-000000@mail.firefox.com> (***this can be falsified***) Delivered-To: '''(***redacted***)''' Received: (qmail 404816 invoked from network); 21 Aug 2025 20:14:47 -0000 Received: from a59-50.smtp-out.us-west-2.amazonses.com (HELO a59-50.smtp-out.us-west-2.amazonses.com) (54.240.59.50) (***This can be falsified***) by (***redacted***) with (TLS_AES_128_GCM_SHA256 encrypted) ESMTPS (7b9ce110-7e*********341ca7f98); Thu, 21 Aug 2025 16:14:47 -0400 DKIM-Signature: v=1; a=rsa-sha256; q=dns/txt; c=relaxed/simple; s=6ujb3doj4mwbng********3; d=firefox.com; t=1755***286; h=From:Sender:To:Subject:Message-ID:Date:MIME-Version:Content-Type; bh=T5q+t93Z3ALFYCbyT*********+OJW/vRrGhTg=; b=bTLofV7VLWXo/EmaTMwly2r35torEW7HAKOXuASjJwxiq73VLbKz2vMHZOGXEluu RMG5I1DUwpy4dn**********Tg1gS7ZSS+GuyCwMAASjyweSMvKZhlANnNfbW C9PUvylBVj272EhtTk9s4MBFIIjOPZmrwe+zmo2Q= DKIM-Signature: v=1; a=rsa-sha256; q=dns/txt; c=relaxed/simple; s=gdwg2y3ko******ilkup5wp5hhxx; d=amazonses.com; t=1755807286; h=From:Sender:To:Subject:Message-ID:Date:MIME-Version:Content-Type:Feedback-ID; bh=T5q+t93Z3ALFYC**********5YdKr+OJW/vRrGhTg=; b=Y0JnPpx1TwX2E51oYf+drgGkglkHNxdZH+/xQcqk5Mku7Wi2YglHZSSyf9kMRJOJ 3nDB5a/DwVo/YLY0l**********ZjFs893PwdsktXopqXEOLSyNGLMRCdh iUcOti/cHJHUSdN5lmrcyAv9zcnMevO9FX5/KpxQ= Content-Language: en-US X-Template-Name: verifyShortCode X-Template-Version: 5 X-Verify-Short-Code: 830807 X-Device-ID: 9e821fb2191******2ad21a34147f59 X-Flow-ID: e437667dd6a6****************f5cc6e044af637002 X-Flow-Begin-Time: 1755807026335 X-Uid: fd5df64e898*********714d932108c From: Mozilla <accounts@firefox.com> (***This cannot be falsified***) Sender: Mozilla <accounts@firefox.com> (***This cannot be falsified***) To: (***redacted***) Subject: Confirm your account Message-ID: <01010198ce4**********763-bd7c-736abf31a416-000000@us-west-2.amazonses.com> Date: Thu, 21 Aug 2025 20:14:45 +0000 MIME-Version: 1.0 Content-Type: multipart/alternative;

title: Certain calendar events now appear as accepted invitations - cannot edit or dismiss.
content:
I hope I can explain this well: Recently, many recurring events from Google Contacts, namely birthdays and anniversaries, now appear in Google Calendar as invitations from "Unknown Organizer <unknownorganizer@calendar.google.com>" that I have accepted (but I have not.) These events keep triggering pop-up notifications. Those notifications do not respond to the Dismiss or Snooze buttons - they do nothing. I can dismiss the dialog box with the upper-right [X], but the pop up gain every time the calendar re-syncs. I try to edit the properties of the event, but the changes do not take. When I look at Google Calendar directly with my browser, these events do not show up, only the proper ones that are listed in my Birthdays calendar.

Why did this happen, and how can I fix this. The un-dismissable notifications make Thunderbird Calendar unusable. I find many similar (but not necessarily identical) complaints going back years, but no actual solutions.

Thunderbird 140.2.0esr Windows 10 22H2 Cardbook address book add-on 100.4
